content.description: The "toughest" route on the narrow face of The Shield.  Start up the blankish center and tend slightly left to the jug/ledge where you can match hands.  Pull onto the ledge - the left arete is off route!  Climb the featured, center face with some layback moves coupled with high feet. Pull through the top groove to the false-summit ledge, and scramble up the final step to the trees.  A few pumpy slopers require good friction.
content.location: This goes up the center of The Shield. Start up the blankish center section, and continue straight up toward the top groove. The left arete is off route!

content.description: Start with an easy climbing to a ledge positioned underneath the slightly-overhanging, outside corner (climber's right). Pull some slopers and pockets on your right, and a few crimpers on your left, as you straddle the corner. Reach for the upper crack on the front face, and "hop" your body to reach the juggy ledge. Finish with a fun jug-haul to the top.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on The Shield. Look for the slightly-overhanging, outside corner. The line runs parallel to the maple tree growing in front of the face. A toprope fall from the crux will swing you away from the face and into this maple tree.

content.description: Layback or face climb the lower left side of The Shield. Match hands on a big jug/block, and pull up to a sloping ledge. Hands moving up the left arete offer an easier path to the top. This approach uses the featured, center face for foot placements. Finish up the groove to the top ledge.
content.location: It ascends the left side/arete of The Shield.

content.description: This is the small, lower crag protruding from the hillside between The Prow and Burger Boulder.
